nav.div: Los Lunas Schools » News » Internet Access During School Closure

a.title: Free Meals for Students During Closure

div.a: Free Meals for Students During Closure

div.img:
Dear Parents/Guardians,
We hope this email finds families well. We would like to provide you with information to assist families with internet access for your child. We understand that there may be some families that may not be able to utilize the services mentioned below. If you are unable to use any of the options listed, please contact your child’s school for further assistance.
Comcast began offering free access to its network of 100+ hotspots as of 03/15/2020. You are eligible for this access whether or not you are a subscriber to Comcast’s XFinity services. Considering the wide availability of these hotspots in our area, this may be a viable option for students who can either travel to a hotspot or may have one near where they live. Comcast also has begun offering 2-months free on their “Internet Essentials” package with no up-front costs or contract for low-income households who qualify. You may apply for the Internet Essentials package at https://www.internetessentials.com/.
You may also locate Comcast hotspots by going to http://wifi.xfinity.com/ or by downloading the Xfinity Hotspots App.
Other internet Service Providers in the area would include satellite providers like Dish and DirecTV, Century Link DSL, or even Plateautel. You may also contact your cell provider and ask about adding a WiFi hotspot to your cell plan. T-Mobile and Verizon, for example, are offering special deals on access during this time. Plateau is also offering two free months for those they can service in our area as well.
While the initial plan was for the transportation department to use school buses as mobile hotspots during school hours, the district realized that only allowed limited access. With the help of the Valencia County Fire Department, the lieutenant governor of Isleta, and the Tomé Community Center, they are allowing Los Lunas Schools to utilize their buildings and fire stations for wi-fi access around the clock. The internet access at the following locations will begin Wednesday, April 15, 2020.
Wi-Fi Hot Spots Locations:
Fire Station 4
755 Meadow Lake Road
Fire Station 10
311 El Cerro Mission Road
Tomé Community Center
2933 New Mexico Highway 47
Open 8:00am to 3:00pm Monday - Friday
Isleta Library
950 Moonlight Drive SW
Hot spot Name: LLS HotSpot
Password: studentwifi
NMSU is opening hotspots for WiFi with service at 404 Courthouse Road, next to the Old Courthouse on Luna Avenue. The Wi-Fi network that we can access there is called “NMSU Guest,” and the password is “Aggies#1".
Los Lunas Schools Wi-Fi Access: APE - Good signal from benches in entryway BFE - No good signal outside CHS - Good signal from back parking area, some signal immediately in front of the school
CO Admin - good signal parked next to building from side parking lot
DVE - Good signal from sitting area at entrance near the planters.
KGE - good signal from benches in front
LLE - No good access unless very close to building
LLHS - Good signal from front steps
LLMS - No signal from main parking lot with good signal from handicap spaces by gym
Peralta - No good signal from parking lot
RGE - No good access unless very close to building
SE- Good signal from benches very close to entrance
TE - No good signal
VE- Good signal from benches in front of building
VMS - Good signal from parking area just north of L,M, P, Q pods and just outside Library as well as seating area toward entrance
VHS - Good signal from benches outside PAC only or entries
Please remember to practice social distancing as you utilize internet access at any public site. In addition, please do not use the playground equipment at school sites. As this is a violation of the health order issued by the Governor. Stay healthy and safe until we see you again.
